results.title: Learning to live
results.brief_description: During the 1930s Britain was gradually replacing her old,out-dated unhealthy schools with modern well-equipped, fully staffed new schools. Examples of the kind of nursery school, junior school, and senior school which the New Education Act was designed to make the rule rather than the exception throughout Britain, are studied in this film; emphasis is placed on the type of syllabus being taught and the kind of skills being developed in school children in these schools.

results.title: Learning to lead
results.brief_description: A day in the life of the Australian Army Officer Cadet School in Portsea, Victoria. Shows the facilities, intake procedure and the education of new officers, including training manoeuvres.

results.title: Learning to jump
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Justin Milne
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horses: basics to eventing”.
Shows training of horse and rider to jump beginning with poles laid out on the ground and progressing through to a series of jumps.

results.title: Learning to dive. Part 3. Advanced diving
results.brief_description: The progressive stages in learning to dive, the preliminary exercises and the way to gain proficiency. Demonstrated by a class of children aged 8-14 years. Part three: a class of children carry out limbering up exercises on land and then instructed in and perform the following five basic acrobatic dives; the forward somersault dive, the back dive, the back-front dive, the reverse dive, the half-twisting dive.

results.title: Learning to dive. Part 2. Diving from the springboard
results.brief_description: The progressive stages in learning to dive, the preliminary exercises and the way to gain proficiency. Demonstrated by a class of children aged 8-14 years. Part two: the action and response of the springboard. A class of children carry out exercises on the side of the pool and on the board, leading up to swallow dives from boards of various heights.

results.title: Learning to dive. Part 1. The Standing plain dive
results.brief_description: The progressive stages in learning to dive, the preliminary exercises and the way to gain proficiency. Demonstrated by a class of children aged 8-14 years. Part one: confidence exercises in shallow water; simple dives in four positions from the side of the pool; practice in the correct stance, jumping and arm movements; jumps into the water at the deep end and finally correct standing dives.

results.title: Learning Through Play
results.creator_credit: Monash University, World Organisation for early Childhood Development, Don Hauser and Nicholas Alexander
results.brief_description: Looks at play amongst three year-olds and the more highly developed and realistic play of five year-olds. Shows the role of the teacher in various situations providing challenging equipment to extend the interests of the children and in guiding play to complement structured learning.
